item.title: Creating a Real .vimrc
item.description: While vim was the first power editor I learned and used in college, I quickly forgot about most of it’s commands after switching to Emacs over the last few years. At my new job, I work more in remote terminal sessions, where VIM really is king. So, I figured it was time to scrape off the rust and actually setup a real .vimrc configuration again.
